rdfs:label: Data Processor
dct:description: ‘processor’ means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which processes personal data on behalf of the controller;
dct:creator: Harshvardhan J. Pandit

rdfs:label: Data Sub-Processor
dct:description: A processor engaged by another processor
dct:creator: Harshvardhan J. Pandit

rdfs:label: Third Party
dct:description: ‘third party’ means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or body other than the data subject, controller, processor and persons who, under the direct authority of the controller or processor, are authorised to process personal data;
dct:creator: Harshvardhan J. Pandit

rdfs:label: Child
dct:description: A 'child' is a natural legal person who is below a certain legal age depending on the legal jurisdiction.
rdfs:comment: A 'child' is distinct from a 'minor'. For example, the legal age for a 'minor' in most countries is 18, whereas a 'child' can be a minor below the age of 14.
dct:creator: Harshvardhan J. Pandit

rdfs:label: Data Protection Authority
dct:description: An authority that has legal powers to undertake investigations and issue decisions regarding data protection and privacy laws and compliance.
dct:creator: Harshvardhan J. Pandit

rdfs:label: Joint Controller
dct:description: A Joint Controller consists of two or more controllers who together determine the purposes of processing personal data
dct:creator: Harshvardhan J. Pandit
